Total investments from @TheJusticeDept amount to more than $10 million. Barr and the U.S. Justice Department are clearly committed to helping the people in Alaska who need it the most. 
 https://www.sullivan.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/alaska-congressional-delegation-welcome-doj-declaration-of-law-enforcement-emergency-in-rural-alaska …

General Barr today declared a law enforcement emergency in rural #Alaska and made $6 million available to support critical law enforcement needs in Alaska Native villages. Barr also authorized additional funding to invest in victim services and village public safety.

In discussions w/ federal, state & local law enforcement, victim advocates, & community leaders, as well as in travels to rural areas, #AttorneyGeneral Bill Barr came to us, listened & gave us his word that @TheJusticeDept would take serious, concrete action to help our state.

As Alaskans know, we have a public safety crisis. The statistics, particularly related to sexual assault and child abuse, are horrifying. But statistics don’t tell the full story, which comes from the people themselves—stories of heartbreak, and suffering, and wrecked lives.

Cal Williams, our #AlaskanoftheWeek, has been a leader in Anchorage going back to the 1960s. Cal was instrumental in the early civil rights movement in #Alaska  and continues to bring his energy, talents & faith to serve others and enrich our community. https://youtu.be/GwGI7FRhds4

I introduced Senate resolution designating June 27 as a day to raise awareness about the challenges PTS causes veterans & their families, and our resolve to help veterans achieve the physical, mental & emotional wellness they deserve. #PTSDAwarenessDay 🔽

The wounds of war inflicted upon our brave men and women in uniform are not always visible. Many #veterans continue to face the traumatic situations they’ve experienced in a warzone, as well as the stigma too often associated with mental illness. #PTSDAwarenessDay

As I shared w/ @Ch2KTUU, with regard to the terrorist regime in Tehran, time is on our side. The sanctions are working. Iran’s economy & ability to export oil are shrinking, as US production is leading the world, & #Iran’s funding for terrorist groups around world is decreasing. https://twitter.com/Ch2KTUU/status/1142201686586515457 …

I appreciate the Trump admin’s measured response to #Iran. The red line for a military response should be if U.S. military members are credibly threatened, injured or killed. It’s one thing to shoot down an unmanned drone. It would be quite another thing to kill Americans.

Some 60 Alaska Guardsmen are in #Mongolia this week participating in #KhaanQuest19, a major multinational military exercise. Glad to see Alaska’s service members taking part in this  opportunity that highlights our strong partnership with a crucial ally. 🇺🇸🇲🇳@usembmongolia https://twitter.com/INDOPACOM/status/1140714186177052672 …
This is not an ideal situation, and I hope this trade dispute is resolved soon with a fair and comprehensive resolution for both of our countries. #China #Trade

I joined @lisamurkowski & @repdonyoung in sending a letter to @USDA @SecretarySonny urging the administration to extend aid to our fishermen and seafood processors and help make them whole during this period of uncertainty. #China #Trade ✉️ https://sen.gov/2P82

Other vital industries – like our robust domestic fisheries – must also be given consideration by the federal government as they weather the lost markets and reprocessing opportunities they’ve relied on for years. #China #Trade

I support @POTUS's ultimate goal of rebalancing #trade relationship between our countries. In May, the Trump administration announced $15 billion in aid to America’s farmers, supporting those Americans who’ve had their own livelihoods threatened by Chinese retaliation. #China

For far too many years, American workers and businesses have experienced a wildly imbalanced #trade relationship with #China. We can only imagine the number of jobs and opportunities that have been lost by past administrations' failure to address this disparity.

The bill will help protect patients from financial strain as the result of disputes between insurance companies & providers, and significantly increase the transparency of that process. This is a step in the right direction of lowering the exorbitant cost of health care.

Through no fault of their own, too many Americans get hit with outrageously expensive medical bills as a result of a confusing and opaque health care billing system. I was glad to sign on as a cosponsor of the STOP Surprise Medical Bills Act.  https://bit.ly/2QF2Jia  pic.twitter.com/blT7YQ50Gd
